00049 //
00050 // TagList
00051 //
00052 // March 2004 -- metzler
00053 //
00054 
00055 #include "indri/Tag.hpp"
00056 #include <stdio.h>
00057 #include <string.h>
00058 #include <indri/greedy_vector>
00059 #include "indri/TagExtent.hpp"
00060 #include <iostream>
00061 #include "indri/MetadataPair.hpp"
00062 #include "indri/Buffer.hpp"
00063 
00064 #ifndef _TAGLIST_HPP
00065 #define _TAGLIST_HPP
00066 
00067 class TagList {
00068 private:
00069   struct tag_entry {
00070     const char* name;
00071     const char* conflation;
00072     int next;
00073     int begin;
00074     int end;
00075   };
00076 
00077   greedy_vector<tag_entry> _tags;
00078   int _openList;
00079 
00080 public:
00081   TagList() {
00082     clear();
00083   }
00084 
00085   void clear() {
00086     _tags.clear();
00087     _openList = -1;
00088   }
00089 
00090   // we assume here that name is more or less immutable
00091   // so we can store a pointer to it.  This is a reasonable
00092   // assumption, because if the tag is indexed, its name is
00093   // in a hash table somewhere, and we can just point to that
00094   // name copy.
00095   void addTag(const char *name, const char* conflation, int begin) {
00096     // because of conflations, all kinds of messy stuff
00097     // happens if there's already an open tag with the same
00098     // conflation as this one.  Therefore, we have to go looking
00099     // for all open tags with this conflation; if there are any,
00100     // this tag doesn't get added.
00101     int list = _openList;
00102 
00103     while( list >= 0 ) {
00104       tag_entry& entry = _tags[list];
00105 
00106       if( !strcmp( entry.conflation, conflation ) ) {
00107         // we already have one of these
00108         return;
00109       }
00110    
00111       list = entry.next;
00112     }
00113 
00114     // all clear now to add the tag:
00115     tag_entry t;
00116     t.name = name;
00117     t.conflation = conflation;
00118     t.begin = begin;
00119     t.end = -1;
00120     t.next = _openList;
00121     _tags.push_back(t);
00122     _openList = _tags.size()-1;
00123   }
00124 
00125   void endTag(const char *name, const char* conflation, int end) {
00126     int list = _openList;
00127     int prev = -1;
00128 
00129     while( list >= 0 ) {
00130       tag_entry& entry = _tags[list];
00131 
00132       if( !strcmp( entry.name, name ) ) {
00133         // found a tag to close
00134         entry.end = end;
00135         int next = entry.next;
00136 
00137         // unlink from open list
00138         if( prev == -1 ) {
00139           _openList = next;
00140         } else {
00141           _tags[prev].next = next;
00142         }
00143         
00144         return;
00145       } else {
00146         // this wasn't the tag, so keep looking
00147         prev = list;
00148         list = entry.next;
00149       }
00150     }
00151   }
00152 
00153   void writeTagList( greedy_vector<TagExtent>& tags ) {
00154     // look through the tags vector; they're already in sorted order by open
00155     // position.  Only add closed tags.
00156 
00157     for( unsigned int i=0; i<_tags.size(); i++ ) {
00158       tag_entry& entry = _tags[i];
00159 
00160       if( entry.end > 0 ) {
00161         TagExtent extent;
00162         extent.begin = entry.begin;
00163         extent.end = entry.end;
00164         extent.name = entry.conflation;
00165         extent.number = 0;
00166         tags.push_back(extent);
00167       }
00168     }
00169   }
00170 
00171   // in this case, we'll treat the list of tags in this list
00172   // as if they were offsets into a metadata list
00173   void writeMetadataList( greedy_vector<MetadataPair>& pairs, Buffer& buffer, const char* docText ) {
00174     for( unsigned int i=0; i<_tags.size(); i++ ) {
00175       tag_entry& entry = _tags[i];
00176 
00177       if( entry.end > 0 ) {
00178         MetadataPair pair;
00179         
00180         // copy the text into a buffer
00181         int length = entry.end - entry.begin;
00182         char* spot = buffer.write(length+1);
00183         strncpy( spot, docText + entry.begin, length);
00184         spot[length] = 0;
00185 
00186         pair.key = entry.conflation;
00187         pair.value = spot;
00188         pair.valueLength = length+1;
00189 
00190         // docno is special -- its value must be stripped
00191         if( !strcmp( pair.key, "docno" ) ) {
00192           pair.stripValue();
00193         }
00194 
00195         pairs.push_back(pair);
00196       }
00197     }
00198   }
00199 
00200 };
00201 
00202 #endif
